paper_abstract: We present the concept of a certificate-based proxy decryption (CBPd) system with revocability, which has the following properties: (1) key-escrow freeness; (2) implicit certification; (3) revocability without public key change; and (4) fine-grained delegation. A concrete CBPd scheme is also proposed. The scheme is semantically secure against adaptive chosen plaintext attack (IND-CBPd-Rev-CPA) under the decisional bilinear Diffie-Hellman assumption in the standard model. We also give an enhanced scheme that is secure against adaptive chosen ciphertext attacks (IND-CBPd-Rev-CCA) in the standard model. (C) 2013 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Certificate-based proxy decryption systems with revocability in the standard model
